intro: Simocheilus multiflorus var. atherstonei, commonly known as the Atherstone's multiflorous simocheilus, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically features slender stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in dense inflorescences, and bloom during the cooler months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
